title: 'He is one of the greatest leaders that have ever lived.' Is this sentence correct? - Quora

response.answer_text: While the phrase “He is one of the greatest leaders that have ever lived” is grammatically correct, your sentence is a superb example of what I would consider “unwieldy English”. We have such awkward English excerpts when text is correct but can seem arguably clumsy or cumbersome at the same time. In such circumstances, we may sense that there is something that does not seem right with the text - when that happens, the text fails even though its structure may be correct. If you agree, one way to remove the clumsiness in your sentence is to instead write, “He is one of the greatest leaders that has ever lived.”

The original question is: "He is one of the greatest leaders that have ever lived." Is this sentence correct? Answer: Yes, it is correct. The sentence compares the subject, “he,” to the group of greatest leaders who have ever lived and correctly states that the subject is one of that group.
